prompt:
---
name: Extract Elements of Text
description: Extract specific elements of text from a given text
source: OpenAI documentation
url: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/6654000-best-practices-for-prompt-engineering-with-the-openai-api
inputs: 
   text:
      type: string
---
system:
Extract the important entities mentioned in the text below. First extract all company names, then extract all people names, then extract specific topics which fit the content and finally extract general overarching themes

Desired format:
Company names: <comma_separated_list_of_company_names>
People names: -||-
Specific topics: -||-
General themes: -||-
user:
Text: {{ text }}
inputSpec:
The input is a block of text.
The text can contain names of companies. The text can contain names of people. The text can include specific topics related to the content. The text may include general overarching themes. The text has no specific length constraint but should be complete enough to contain relevant entities. The text should be in a human-readable format and in an understandable language.
rules: The chatbot output must begin with "Company names:" followed by a comma-separated list of company names extracted from the provided text.
The list of company names must not include any entities that are not explicitly mentioned as companies.
The "Company names:" section must appear first in the output before any other sections.
The chatbot output must continue with "People names:" followed by a comma-separated list of people names extracted from the provided text.
The list of people names must not include any entities that are not explicitly identified as people.
Following "People names:", the output must contain "Specific topics:" followed by a comma-separated list of specific topics that are directly relevant to the content of the provided text.
The "Specific topics:" section must only include topics that can be concretely identified from the text, avoiding overly general or unrelated topics.
Finally, the output must include "General themes:" followed by a comma-separated list of general overarching themes that broadly capture the essence of the content in the provided text.
The output must list general themes that encapsulate the text holistically, reflecting broader societal, cultural, or contextual elements.
Each section in the response must be formatted exactly as described, with section labels followed by a colon and the respective lists.
Each section label in the response must be distinct and separated using a new line between each section.
The response must not include any introductory text, explanations, or extraneous information not specified in the desired format.
inverseRules: The chatbot output must not begin with "Company names:" or include any list of company names extracted from the provided text.
The list of company names may include entities that are not explicitly mentioned as companies.
The "Company names:" section must not appear first in the output before any other sections.
The chatbot output must not continue with "People names:" or include a comma-separated list of people names extracted from the provided text.
The list of people names may include entities that are not explicitly identified as people.
Following "People names:", the output must not contain "Specific topics:" or include a list of specific topics related to the content of the provided text.
The "Specific topics:" section may include topics that cannot be concretely identified from the text.
Finally, the output must not include "General themes:" or a list of general overarching themes related to the content in the provided text.
The output must list general themes unrelated to the text, ignoring broader societal, cultural, or contextual elements.
Each section in the response must be formatted differently than described, without section labels followed by a colon and the respective lists.
Each section label in the response must not be distinct and should not be separated using a new line between sections.
The response must include introductory text, explanations, and extraneous information not specified in the desired format.

Text: "In a recent press conference, Microsoft announced its strategic partnership with OpenAI to advance artificial intelligence research. CEOs Satya Nadella of Microsoft and Sam Altman of OpenAI emphasized the importance of ethical guidelines in AI development. They also mentioned partnerships with other organizations like Google and IBM to promote collaboration and innovation. The conference highlighted topics such as machine learning, neural networks, and AI ethics, stressing the overall theme of responsible AI advancement."

Company names: Microsoft, OpenAI, Google, IBM  
People names: Satya Nadella, Sam Altman  
Specific topics: Machine learning, neural networks, AI ethics  
General themes: Responsible AI advancement

Discussions revolved around creating engaging digital experiences and maintaining user trust in the digital age."
